Class Player

java.lang.Object
  Player

public class Player
extends java.lang.Object

A Player can be used to store information about and simulate the actions of a Monopoly player.

Author:
Thomas Zaki

Constructor Summary
Player()
          Creates a standard Player object with the following default instance field values:
name: "UNKNOWN"
piece: 0
space: 0 (Go)
money: $1500
doubles: 0 (never rolled doubles)
inJail: false (not in jail)
timeInJail: 0 (has not spet a turn in jail)

Constructor Detail

Player

public Player()
Creates a standard Player object with the following default instance field values:
name: "UNKNOWN"
piece: 0
space: 0 (Go)
money: $1500
doubles: 0 (never rolled doubles)
inJail: false (not in jail)
timeInJail: 0 (has not spet a turn in jail)
